status_notes: Case Closed. Case Resolved. Dear Constituent,. Eversource Electric is installing a new transmission line on H St. This will improve the reliability of electrical service in South Boston. The contractor is McCourt. The Boston Public Works Construction Inspection Unit (CIU) regularly inspects the work and has found for the most part they are in compliance with our rules and regs. Regarding your call, we contacted McCourt who stated National Grid had to move their pipe in order for McCourt. to proceed at the location in question. I then called National Grid who stated once the work had started they needed to finish it because they didn’t want a pipe opened for an extended period of time. The gas work is now complete. McCourt works from 7am-5pm Monday thru Friday. I have asked McCourt that if they have to work past 5pm for valid reasons to contact the CIU first. The City acknowledges this is a major project and is an inconvenience to the residents of the street and we appreciate your patience and cooperation. For any questions or concerns, please contact the number listed below. Sincerely,. Mark Cardarelli. Supervisor of Utility Coordination and Compliance. Boston Public Works Department. 617-635-4951 Office.

status_notes: Case Closed. Case Resolved. ON THURSDAY 10/8/2016  THE CONSTRUCTION CREW WAS WORKING ON PEARL ST. WE HAD THE RIGHT LANE CLOSED FROM HIGH ST.TO ALMOST FRANKLIN ST.THE JOB WE HAD WAS TO REPLACE A POLE BUT THE OLD POLE WAS A CAST IRON POLE WITH NUTS IN LIKE A SLOT THIS JOB TAKES A LOT OF TIME BECAUSE YOU CANT GET AT THE NUTS WITH THE IMPACT GUN AND IS VERY DIFFICULT TO GET IN WITH A HAND WRENCH. WE WERE IN A VERY HIGH PEDESTRAN FOOT TRAFFIC AREA AND WE HAD 1/2 THE SIDE WALK CLOSED OF AS WELL. THE EMERGANCY LIGHTS WILL NOT OPERATE IF THE TRUCK IS NOT RUNNING.WITH ALL THE PEOP[LE WALKING ON THE SIDE WALK THROUGH THE JOB SITE AND FROM IN BETWEEN THE TRUCKS IT IS NESSESARY TO HAVE THE EMERGANCY LIGHTS ON. WE HAD 5 VEICHELS ON SITE RUNNING WITH ALL THE EMERGANCY LIGHTS AND FLASHES GOING FOR SAFTY. 2 OF THE 5 TRUCKS SHUT DOWN BUT THE EMERGANCY LIGHTS STILL WORK. THE OTHERS ARE OLDER AND DON'T HAVE THE FEATURE OF STOPPING AND STARTING AS NEEDED ON THEIR OWN.WE HAD A PICK UP AT EACH END OF THE JOB SITE WITH ALL THE EMERGANCY LIGHTS AND FLASHES GOIND AS TO WARN THE PUBLIC THAT THIS WAS AN ACTIVE WORK SITE.IN THE INTREST OF PUBLIC SAFTY THIS IS WHAT WE NORMALY DO SO THAT NOBODY GETS INJURED.I WAS ON SITE WITH ONE PICK UP TRUCK AT ONE END OF THE JOB SITE AND MY SUPERVISOR MIKE DONOVAN HAD THE OTHER OICK UP AT THE OTHER END OF THE JOB SITE. ALTHOUGH WE HAD THE TRUCKS ON SITE WITH THE EMERGANCY LIGHTS GOING WE WERE ON SITE WORKING THE TRUYCKS WERE NOT JUST LEFT UNATTENDED.

status_notes: Case Closed. Case Resolved. Dear Constituent,. The Boston Public Works Construction Inspection Unit (CIU) Inspector investigated and determined the following:. National Grid activated an emergency permit on September 15th  at 100 Cambridge St to repair a Grade 1 gas leak. Emergency work must be performed no matter what time of day or night in the interest of public safety and the protection of private property. The emergency gas leak  was repaired  but further but further work on the gas main needed to be done. That work was permitted for days 9:30am-3:30pm. National Grid had no right, and was not sanctioned by the City to work at night.  They had no right to alter the signs. The work is almost completed. They will top the patch during the day. National Grid has been ordered to come into City Hall to discuss this serious and flagrant violation of our rules. I apologize on behalf of the City that you had to put up with unnecessary noise. For any questions or concerns, please contact the number listed below. Sincerely,. Mark Cardarelli. Supervisor of Utility Coordination and Compliance. Boston Public Works Department. 617-635-4951 Office.

status_notes: Case Closed. Case Resolved. Dear Constituent,. Eversource Electric is installing a new transmission line on H St. This will improve the reliability of electrical service in South Boston. The contractor is McCourt. The Boston Public Works Construction Inspection Unit (CIU) regularly inspects the work and has found for the most part they are in compliance with our rules and regs. Regarding your call, we contacted McCourt who stated National Grid had to move their pipe in order for McCourt to proceed at the location in question. I then called National Grid who stated once the work had started they needed to finish it because they didn’t want a pipe opened for an extended period of time. The gas work is now complete. McCourt works from 7am-5pm Monday thru Friday. I have asked McCourt that if they have to work past 5pm for valid reasons to contact the CIU first.]. The City acknowledges this is a major project and is an inconvenience to the residents of the street and we appreciate your patience and cooperation. For any questions or concerns, please contact the number listed below. Sincerely,. Mark Cardarelli. Supervisor of Utility Coordination and Compliance. Boston Public Works Department. 617-635-4951 Office.

status_notes: Case Closed. Case Resolved. Dear Constituent,. As you are well aware of South Boston has had years of new utility infrastructure work. Having new gas , water, sewer, and drain mains is a major benefit to the residents of South Boston but it has also been a major inconvenience.  . Most of the utility work is done.  The City is now paving many of the streets that were impacted by the work. East Broadway was one of them. The City wants to pave between West Broadway and K St.  In order to do this as fast as possible with minimum inconvenience, we did allow the cold planner to start earlier than usual. Instead of being out there between 2-3 weeks we should be completed within a week or so. The cold planning is done.  All remaining phases of work will be done after 7am. The City thanks you for your patience. For any questions or concerns, please contact the number listed below. Sincerely,. Mark Cardarelli. Supervisor of Utility Coordination and Compliance. Boston Public Works Department. 617-635-4951 Office.

status_notes: Case Closed. Case Noted. Two cases were made regarding the leaning and hollow tree at 47 Centre St. One case on 9/14/15 was for pruning the tree and the other made on 9/8/15 was made for the removal of the tree. An inspector that is a Massachusetts Certified Arborist went to inspect the site and deemed that the tree was a hazard because it was leaning, had a large wound at the base which extended up the trunk that was completely decayed and was missing bark on a large section of the trunk. Once a hazardous tree is identified it is put on a removal list and given to the removal contractor. The site will be inspected for a new tree to be planted this spring.

status_notes: Case Closed. Case Resolved.  Dear Constituent,. The Boston Public Works Construction Inspection Unit (CIU) investigated and determined the following:. The Boston Water & Sewer Commission (BWSC) is installing a new  water,  sewer, and drain mains on Alther St.  This is the type of infrastructure  upgrades the  City highly encourages. .  The work is permitted for days. The contractor is  also doing work nearby on Hampden St which is permitted for nights. The crew  did not have permission to work  on Alther St at night.. We contacted the contractor Fed Corp and told him he had no right to be working at night.  He apologized and said it will never happen again. To show him how important a violation this was, we have shut down Fed Corp and will be meeting tomorrow  with both BWSC and Fed Corp  to review exactly what happened and to make sure it will never happen again. The City apologizes for this unnecessary inconvenience. For any questions or concerns, please contact the number listed below. Sincerely,. Mark Cardarelli. Supervisor of Utility Coordination and Compliance. Boston Public Works Department. 617-635-4951 Office.

description:
Since the opening of Garage (around June 2015) Linden St. has seen a staggering increase in violence including one stabbing, a car fire, a shooting, multiple acts of vandalism (to a child day care center no less), breaking and entering (into said day care center) and an incalculable number of noise complaints. At some point, these "coincidences" cease to be so.

Today specifically, I have been motivated to make my first report because I partially witnessed the shooting. I believe that Garage is giving individuals the opportunity to commit these crimes and that the closure of the business will help in these matters.

Over the past summer, the degree of safety I have felt simply walking home from school has decreased to a nearly nonexistent level. I now walk with my keys wrapped between my knuckles just in case.

I respectively request that you revoke Garage's business license to help insure the health of the community and its members before someone gets seriously injured (again).

status_notes: Case Closed. Case Resolved. The PWD Roadway Repair Contractor is working on your street performing patch paving. It is an important city service for your neighborhood to provide the best permanent repairs of previous utility excavations or potholes.  The construction process is to dig out 6.5 inches of material and place 5 inches of dense binder hot mix asphalt in 2 lifts. The dense binder gives the patch its strength but is has large stones and is not conducive to providing a smooth ride, the contractor usually within a week comes back and places 1.5 inches of  the top course. The top course is hot mix asphalt  that provides the smooth ride. What you observed was the patch in binder awaiting the final top course.  Any questions you call the City Engineer Tom Mougamian. 617-304-7308.  The city apologizes for the inconvenience this necessary work has caused.  Sincerely,. Mark Cardarelli. Supervisor of Utility Coordination and Compliance. Boston Public Works Department. 617-635-4951 Office.

status_notes: Case Closed. Case Resolved. Dear Constituent,. The PWD Roadway Repair Contractor was working on your street performing patch paving. It is an important city service for your neighborhood to provide the best permanent repairs of previous utility excavations or potholes.  The construction process is to dig out 6.5 inches of material and place 5 inches of dense binder hot mix asphalt in 2 lifts. The dense binder gives the patch its strength but is has large stones and is not conducive to providing a smooth ride, the contractor usually within a week comes back and places 1.5 inches of  the top course. The top course is hot mix asphalt  that provides the smooth ride.  The street is leafleted before the work begins where it explains that it is a mufti phase construction operation and you should look at the dates since they will change as each construction phases progresses.  Our goal is to allow parking between phases and not post the street for the entire time the work takes place. This is why the contractor repeatedly changes the dates. We spoke to the contractor about his need to be totally accurate when posting and leafleting  for upcoming work.  Since this is a patching contract, the contractor may only be on your street for only a short period of time; giving the appearance of not showing up.  Sometimes  poor weather, plant breakdowns, or equipment failure occurs which results in the delay of the upcoming work.  The CIU spoke to the contractor about his need to do a better job on changing the dates when those situations arise.  Any questions you call the City Engineer Tom Mougamian. 617-304-7308. The city apologizes for the inconvenience this necessary work has caused. Sincerely,. Mark Cardarelli. Supervisor of Utility Coordination and Compliance. Boston Public Works Department. 617-635-4951 Office.

status_notes: Case Closed. Case Resolved. Dear Constituent,. The PWD Roadway Repair Contractor is working on your street performing patch paving. It is an important city service for your neighborhood to provide the best permanent repairs of previous utility excavations or potholes. The utility work previously done on your street was left with a temporary patch. The City of Boston does not want the permanent asphalt cross section (typically 6.5" on residential street and 7.5"on main arterials) to be put back after the gravel down to the pipe has been disturbed. There is a possibility that settlement could occur. Thats why the City waits before performing the cross section repair.  Our permanent patches hardly ever settle and that is the goal that any City or Town would want to happen regarding utility excavation work. We do have a unit that inspects backfilling and temporary patches (The Construction Inspection Unit CIU) The CIU does stay on top of the contractors and utility companies.  Many of the temporary patches are in good condition. However, the key is the patch is only 3".  We need the full cross section put back. This is what you are seeing being done on your street right now. Below is the steps taken to do the permanent repair. The construction process is to dig out 6.5 to 7.5" inches of material and place 5 inches of dense binder hot mix asphalt in 2 lifts. The dense binder gives the patch its strength but is has large stones and is not conducive to providing a smooth ride, the contractor usually within a week comes back and places 1.5 inches of the top course. The top course is hot mix asphalt that provides the smooth ride. I hope this explanation clarifies things for you. If not please don't hesitate to call me. Sincerely,. Mark Cardarelli. Supervisor of Utility Coordination and Compliance. Boston Public Works Department. 617-635-4951 Office.

status_notes: Case Closed. Case Resolved. Dear Constituent,. All contractors working in the City of Boston are required to have Police details. A Police detail was called for this job. Sometimes, the details are not filled, or a Police officer is up the street giving the appearance that there was no police detail called. Unfortunately in this case, the detail was not filled. The PWD has reached out to the Boston Police about the need to fill the detail requests. The City apologizes for the inconvenience for this necessary work. Any questions or concerns you can contact the number listed below. Sincerely,. Mark Cardarelli. Supervisor of Utility Coordination and Compliance. Boston Public Works Department. 617-635-4951 Office.
